benchmark_details.name: PRIMUS (A Pioneering Collection of Open-Source Datasets for Cybersecurity LLM Training)
benchmark_details.overview: PRIMUS is a comprehensive suite of open-source datasets aimed at improving LLM performance in cybersecurity through pretraining, instruction fine-tuning, and reasoning distillation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a series of carefully curated datasets for enhancing the capabilities of LLMs in cybersecurity.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited computational resources constrain experiments to 8B-scale models.

data.source: Cybersecurity texts from reputable sources and web crawling.
data.annotation: Expert curation and automated filtering techniques.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the performance across various cybersecurity benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance on cybersecurity tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluations performed using standardized processes to ensure reliability.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential biases in model training data leading to unfair outcomes.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: ODC-BY and MIT licenses for datasets.
